instruction: Choose the difference between a cat and a dog in terms of their typical sounds.
input: A) Cats and dogs both make barking sounds. B) Cats meow and dogs bark. C) Cats purr and dogs howl. D) Cats hiss and dogs whine. E) Cats and dogs both make similar sounds.
output: B) Cats meow and dogs bark.

instruction: Choose the difference between an apple and a banana in terms of their shape.
input: A) Apples and bananas are both round. B) Apples are round and bananas are elongated. C) Apples are elongated and bananas are round. D) Apples and bananas are both oval. E) Apples and bananas have no difference in shape.
output: B) Apples are round and bananas are elongated.

instruction: Choose the difference between a car and a bicycle in terms of their method of propulsion.
input: A) Cars and bicycles both use pedals. B) Cars use an engine and bicycles use pedals. C) Cars use pedals and bicycles use an engine. D) Cars and bicycles both use electricity. E) Cars and bicycles use the same method of propulsion.
output: B) Cars use an engine and bicycles use pedals.

instruction: Choose the difference between a river and a lake in terms of their flow.
input: A) Rivers and lakes both flow constantly. B) Rivers flow constantly and lakes are still. C) Rivers are still and lakes flow constantly. D) Rivers and lakes have no flow. E) Rivers and lakes have the same flow.
output: B) Rivers flow constantly and lakes are still.

instruction: Choose the difference between a mountain and a hill in terms of their height.
input: A) Mountains and hills are the same height. B) Mountains are much taller than hills. C) Hills are much taller than mountains. D) Mountains and hills have no difference in height. E) Mountains and hills are both very short.
output: B) Mountains are much taller than hills.

instruction: Choose the difference between a book and a magazine in terms of their length of content.
input: A) Books and magazines have the same length of content. B) Books typically have longer content than magazines. C) Magazines typically have longer content than books. D) Books and magazines have no content. E) Books and magazines are the same size.
output: B) Books typically have longer content than magazines.

instruction: Choose the difference between a tree and a flower in terms of their lifespan.
input: A) Trees and flowers have the same lifespan. B) Trees generally live much longer than flowers. C) Flowers generally live much longer than trees. D) Trees and flowers have no lifespan. E) Trees and flowers both live for only a few days.
output: B) Trees generally live much longer than flowers.

instruction: Choose the difference between the sun and the moon in terms of their light source.
input: A) The sun and moon both produce their own light. B) The sun produces its own light and the moon reflects sunlight. C) The moon produces its own light and the sun reflects sunlight. D) The sun and moon have no light. E) The sun and moon have the same light source.
output: B) The sun produces its own light and the moon reflects sunlight.

instruction: Choose the difference between a square and a circle in terms of their angles.
input: A) Squares and circles have the same angles. B) Squares have four 90-degree angles and circles have no angles. C) Circles have four 90-degree angles and squares have no angles. D) Squares and circles both have many angles. E) Squares and circles both have no angles.
output: B) Squares have four 90-degree angles and circles have no angles.

instruction: Choose the difference between a keyboard and a mouse in terms of their function.
input: A) Keyboards and mouses have the same function. B) Keyboards input text and mouses control a cursor. C) Keyboards control a cursor and mouses input text. D) Keyboards and mouses have no function. E) Keyboards and mouses are both used for typing.
output: B) Keyboards input text and mouses control a cursor.

instruction: Choose the difference between a cup and a glass in terms of their material.
input: A) Cups and glasses are always made of the same material. B) Cups are typically made of ceramic and glasses are typically made of glass. C) Glasses are typically made of ceramic and cups are typically made of glass. D) Cups and glasses are never made of the same material. E) Cups and glasses both are always metal.
output: B) Cups are typically made of ceramic and glasses are typically made of glass.

instruction: Choose the difference between an ocean and a sea in terms of their size.
input: A) Oceans and seas are the same size. B) Oceans are generally much larger than seas. C) Seas are generally much larger than oceans. D) Oceans and seas have no difference in size. E) Oceans and seas are both very small.
output: B) Oceans are generally much larger than seas.

instruction: Choose the difference between a plane and a train in terms of their mode of transportation.
input: A) Planes and trains travel on the ground. B) Planes travel in the air and trains travel on the ground. C) Trains travel in the air and planes travel on the ground. D) Planes and trains have no mode of transportation. E) Planes and trains travel underwater.
output: B) Planes travel in the air and trains travel on the ground.

instruction: Choose the difference between a solid and a liquid in terms of their shape.
input: A) Solids and liquids have the same shape. B) Solids retain their shape and liquids take the shape of their container. C) Liquids retain their shape and solids take the shape of their container. D) Solids and liquids have no shape. E) Solids and liquids are both shapeless.
output: B) Solids retain their shape and liquids take the shape of their container.

instruction: Choose the difference between a song and a poem in terms of their expression.
input: A) Songs and poems are always expressed in the same way. B) Songs are typically sung and poems are typically read. C) Poems are typically sung and songs are typically read. D) Songs and poems have no expression. E) Songs and poems both are spoken.
output: B) Songs are typically sung and poems are typically read.

instruction: Choose the difference between a continent and a country in terms of their size.
input: A) Continents and countries are the same size. B) Continents are generally much larger than countries. C) Countries are generally much larger than continents. D) Continents and countries have no size. E) Continents and countries are both very small.
output: B) Continents are generally much larger than countries.

instruction: Choose the difference between a city and a village in terms of their population.
input: A) Cities and villages have the same population. B) Cities generally have much larger populations than villages. C) Villages generally have much larger populations than cities. D) Cities and villages have no population. E) Cities and villages are both unpopulated.
output: B) Cities generally have much larger populations than villages.

instruction: Choose the difference between a table and a chair in terms of their function.
input: A) Tables and chairs serve the same function. B) Tables are for placing things on and chairs are for sitting. C) Chairs are for placing things on and tables are for sitting. D) Tables and chairs have no function. E) Tables and chairs are both for sleeping.
output: B) Tables are for placing things on and chairs are for sitting.

instruction: Choose the difference between a spoon and a fork in terms of their tines.
input: A) Spoons and forks have the same number of tines. B) Spoons have no tines and forks have multiple tines. C) Forks have no tines and spoons have multiple tines. D) Spoons and forks both have one tine. E) Spoons and forks both have no tines.
output: B) Spoons have no tines and forks have multiple tines.

instruction: Choose the difference between a shirt and a jacket in terms of their warmth.
input: A) Shirts and jackets provide the same level of warmth. B) Jackets generally provide more warmth than shirts. C) Shirts generally provide more warmth than jackets. D) Shirts and jackets provide no warmth. E) Shirts and jackets are both made of cotton.
output: B) Jackets generally provide more warmth than shirts.

instruction: Choose the difference between a pen and a pencil in terms of their ink source.
input: A) Pens and pencils use the same ink source. B) Pens use ink from a cartridge and pencils use graphite. C) Pencils use ink from a cartridge and pens use graphite. D) Pens and pencils have no ink source. E) Pens and pencils both use water for ink.
output: B) Pens use ink from a cartridge and pencils use graphite.

instruction: Choose the difference between a sunrise and a sunset in terms of their time of day.
input: A) Sunrise and sunset occur at the same time of day. B) Sunrise occurs in the morning and sunset occurs in the evening. C) Sunset occurs in the morning and sunrise occurs in the evening. D) Sunrise and sunset occur at midnight. E) Sunrise and sunset never happen.
output: B) Sunrise occurs in the morning and sunset occurs in the evening.

instruction: Choose the difference between a cloud and the sky in terms of their visibility.
input: A) Clouds and the sky have the same visibility. B) Clouds are visible and the sky is the background. C) The sky is visible and clouds are the background. D) Clouds and the sky are both invisible. E) Clouds and sky are both always visible.
output: B) Clouds are visible and the sky is the background.

instruction: Choose the difference between a diamond and a ruby in terms of their color.
input: A) Diamonds and rubies are the same color. B) Diamonds are typically colorless or white and rubies are typically red. C) Rubies are typically colorless or white and diamonds are typically red. D) Diamonds and rubies are always black. E) Diamonds and rubies have no color.
output: B) Diamonds are typically colorless or white and rubies are typically red.

instruction: Choose the difference between ice and water in terms of their state of matter.
input: A) Ice and water are in the same state of matter. B) Ice is a solid and water is a liquid. C) Water is a solid and ice is a liquid. D) Ice and water are both gases. E) Ice and water are both plasmas.
output: B) Ice is a solid and water is a liquid.

instruction: Choose the difference between a tiger and a lion in terms of their stripes.
input: A) Tigers and lions have the same stripes. B) Tigers have stripes and lions typically do not. C) Lions have stripes and tigers typically do not. D) Tigers and lions both have no stripes. E) Tigers and lions both have spots.
output: B) Tigers have stripes and lions typically do not.

instruction: Choose the difference between a zebra and a horse in terms of their stripes.
input: A) Zebras and horses have the same stripes. B) Zebras have stripes and horses typically do not. C) Horses have stripes and zebras typically do not. D) Zebras and horses both have no stripes. E) Zebras and horses both have spots.
output: B) Zebras have stripes and horses typically do not.

instruction: Choose the difference between a giraffe and an elephant in terms of their necks.
input: A) Giraffes and elephants have the same neck length. B) Giraffes have very long necks and elephants have short necks. C) Elephants have very long necks and giraffes have short necks. D) Giraffes and elephants both have no necks. E) Giraffes and elephants both have medium-length necks.
output: B) Giraffes have very long necks and elephants have short necks.

instruction: Choose the difference between a shark and a dolphin in terms of their gills.
input: A) Sharks and dolphins both have gills. B) Sharks have gills and dolphins have lungs. C) Dolphins have gills and sharks have lungs. D) Sharks and dolphins have neither gills nor lungs. E) Sharks and dolphins both have lungs.
output: B) Sharks have gills and dolphins have lungs.

instruction: Choose the difference between a whale and a fish in terms of their breathing.
input: A) Whales and fish breathe the same way. B) Whales breathe air and fish breathe underwater. C) Fish breathe air and whales breathe underwater. D) Whales and fish do not breathe. E) Whales and fish breathe through their skin.
output: B) Whales breathe air and fish breathe underwater.

instruction: Choose the difference between an owl and an eagle in terms of their hunting style.
input: A) Owls and eagles hunt in the same way. B) Owls are nocturnal hunters and eagles are diurnal hunters. C) Eagles are nocturnal hunters and owls are diurnal hunters. D) Owls and eagles don't hunt. E) Owls and eagles both hunt at night.
output: B) Owls are nocturnal hunters and eagles are diurnal hunters.

instruction: Choose the difference between a spider and an insect in terms of their legs.
input: A) Spiders and insects have the same number of legs. B) Spiders have eight legs and insects have six legs. C) Insects have eight legs and spiders have six legs. D) Spiders and insects both have ten legs. E) Spiders and insects both have four legs.
output: B) Spiders have eight legs and insects have six legs.

instruction: Choose the difference between a snake and a lizard in terms of their legs.
input: A) Snakes and lizards have the same number of legs. B) Snakes have no legs and lizards have four legs. C) Lizards have no legs and snakes have four legs. D) Snakes and lizards both have eight legs. E) Snakes and lizards both have six legs.
output: B) Snakes have no legs and lizards have four legs.

instruction: Choose the difference between a kangaroo and a rabbit in terms of their locomotion.
input: A) Kangaroos and rabbits move in the same way. B) Kangaroos hop and rabbits run. C) Rabbits hop and kangaroos run. D) Kangaroos and rabbits both fly. E) Kangaroos and rabbits both swim.
output: B) Kangaroos hop and rabbits run.

instruction: Choose the difference between a butterfly and a moth in terms of their antennae.
input: A) Butterflies and moths have the same antennae. B) Butterflies have club-shaped antennae and moths have feathery or comb-like antennae. C) Moths have club-shaped antennae and butterflies have feathery or comb-like antennae. D) Butterflies and moths have no antennae. E) Butterflies and moths both have straight antennae.
output: B) Butterflies have club-shaped antennae and moths have feathery or comb-like antennae.

instruction: Choose the difference between a frog and a toad in terms of their skin.
input: A) Frogs and toads have the same type of skin. B) Frogs have smooth, moist skin and toads have bumpy, dry skin. C) Toads have smooth, moist skin and frogs have bumpy, dry skin. D) Frogs and toads both have very smooth skin. E) Frogs and toads both have very bumpy skin.
output: B) Frogs have smooth, moist skin and toads have bumpy, dry skin.
